intro: Picris strigosa var. subinflata, commonly known as the narrowleaf gothicweed, is a flowering plant native to regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer. It is considered a weed in some agricultural contexts due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
